intro: Taraxacum crispatum, commonly known as the curlyleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, and often curly leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces a yellow flower head that develops into a white, fluffy seed head, typical of the dandelion genus. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grassy areas and disturbed soils. Taraxacum crispatum is a perennial herb that is known for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
